nodes.bodyText: I chose 500 somewhat arbitrarily;  if anyone objects we can just set it to 1500, which is the max for classes.  In my mind, a record should be more brief than a class, so it made sense to set the default at one-third the length of a class.
I agree. 150 is a more reasonable limit.
I needed to create this to reduce cyclomatic complexity in the leaveToken() method, so I also used this method in the visitToken() method.
Why not move all five tokens here? Compact ctor's are more like "instance init" than methods.
I thought about that, but honestly I couldn't think of a good name for the method.

I ran all of these messages through google translate, and checked them against the messages for classes. I'm not sure what the normal translation protocol is, and the "creating your own check" documentation didn't specify a translation source.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,4 +5,5 @@ cyclomaticComplexity=循環的複雑度が {0,number,integer} （最大 {1,numbe
 ncss.class=このクラスのNCSSが {0,number,integer} （最大 {1,number,integer} まで）です。
 ncss.file=このファイルのNCSSが {0,number,integer} （最大 {1,number,integer} まで）です。
 ncss.method=このメソッドのNCSSが {0,number,integer} （最大 {1,number,integer} まで）です。
+ncss.record=このレコードのNCSS {0,number,integer} （最大 {1,number,integer} まで）です。

nodes.bodyText:
I ran all of these messages through google translate, and checked them against the messages for classes.

Yes, this is exactly what you need to do. However, it is useful to look at similar messages. In this one, you missed "が".
Hint: you can translate the message back to English and see how it has changed. In general, Google translates well, except for some tricky languages. But there are native speakers among the users who can come and explain the difference between "重载" and "重写".

nodes.bodyText:
we usually do simple translate operation, and eventually some native speaker come and update wording. All automated translations are a bit weird, do not spent too much tie on this please.
Interesting fact, maintainers do not speak languages that we support, non of them :)

nodes.bodyText:
I have no idea why all other messages in Finnish have "NCS" instead of "NCSS".
Looks like a bug. I played with the google/microsoft/yandex translators a bit and it looks like there should be "NCSS" here after all.

nodes.bodyText: More likely it is "Bu kaydın açıklama olmayan kaynak kod satırı (NCSS) sayısı"
